page.title: 11West Cliff Hall Hotel Hythe.
page.content: In the centre of the survey area which is to the west of the{New Hythe {Marina Site,}is West Cliff Hall Hotel. It is a large hotel which used to be on the coast but now overlooks drained {Reclaimed Land. The hotel is on a hill surrounded by woodland.At the bottom of the hill is a railway track used by goods trains serving the{Fawley Oil Refinery further south on Southampton Water. The village of Hythe is quite small. There were some small terraced and semi_detatched houses, also many large, seemingly spacious houses. Along the shore we found spent cartridges,so some{shooting}takes place here possibly of rabbit and some wild birds.
